thread.title: Game preview: Kentucky vs. Mississippi State
thread.title_full: Game preview: Kentucky vs. Mississippi State

title: Game preview: Kentucky vs. Mississippi State
text:
Game preview: Kentucky vs. Mississippi State Michael Bonner, The Clarion-Ledger 6:02 a.m. CDT October 23, 2015 Kentucky vs. Mississippi State 35 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Breaking down Saturday's game: 
THE SETUP 
Dan Mullen has never lost to Kentucky since he arrived in Starkville in 2009. Mississippi State has won six in a row against the Wildcats. The Bulldogs’ average margin of victory has been 9.8 points during the winning streak. 
Last year, Mississippi State played its first game in program history as the No. 1 team in the country. Kentucky played MSU to within a touchdown through three quarters. Christian Holmes’ touchdown return on an onside kick widened the final score to a 14-point cushion. Kentucky’s Patrick Towles was the best quarterback on the field through, throwing for a career-best 390 yards and rushing for a career-high 76 yards and two touchdowns. 
3 THINGS WE’RE TALKING ABOUT 
Replacing Redmond 
Mississippi State will be without its top corner for the rest of the season. Will Redmond, who ESPN projected as a first-round draft pick, tore his anterior cruciate ligament last week, sources told the Clarion-Ledger. Redmond led the Bulldogs with two interceptions. Tolando Cleveland will likely replace the senior. Cleveland has started four games this season. The junior has 24 tackles this season, including 2.5 for loss. Other candidates to see increased playing time include Cedric Jiles and Jamoral Graham. 
Multi-scorers 
Mississippi State has found the end zone in six scenarios this season. The Bulldogs’ offense has scored through rushing and passing in multiple games this season. 
Brandon Holloway returned a kick for a touchdown in the season-opener against Southern Miss. Fred Ross returned a punt 77 yards and scored against Troy. Nelson Adams pounced on a fumble for a defensive touchdown in the same game. Last week against Louisiana Tech, Brandon Bryant scored on a 73-yard interception. Bryant almost scored on a punt block last week as well. Mississippi State has yet to return a blocked field goal for a touchdown this year. MSU last returned a punt block for a touchdown 
Elite trio 
With his first touchdown pass last week, Dak Prescott joined Tim Tebow and Johnny Manziel as the only players in Southeastern Conference history with 50 touchdown passes and 30 rushing scores. 
He holds every MSU passing record. He needs 96 yards to eclipse John Bond as the leading rusher in program history by a quarterback. Prescott is four touchdowns away from passing Manziel on the SEC career touchdowns list. He trails Tebow by 763 yards for most rushing yards in conference history by a quarterback. GAME-DAY DATA 
Where: Davis Wade Stadium, Starkville 
Television: SEC Network 
Last meeting: 45-31 MSU, 2014 
All-time series: Tied 21-21 KEEP AN EYE ON 
Patrick Towles, QB: The Kentucky quarterback outplayed Dak Prescott in last year’s matchup. Towles threw for 390 yards and rushed for 76. He scored four touchdowns too. UNIT THAT COULD GIVE MSU FITS 
Kentucky wide receivers : Kentucky boasts two wide-outs that have at least 28 receptions this season. Both Dorian Baker and Garrett Johnson averaged better than 11 yards per catch. The duo also has four touchdown receptions. 35 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://on.thec-l.com/1S0t5VL TOP VIDEOS
